alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 2:14PM MST until July 30 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 214 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tucson, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, South Tucson, Catalina Foothills, and Tucson Estates. This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Agua Caliente Wash Soldier Trail Fort Lowell, Tanque Verde Loop Rd at Tanque Verde Wash, Escalante Rd at Atterbury Wash, Drexel Rd east of Alvernon Way, Limberlost Rd from Soilder Trail to Homestead Ave and Snyder Rd from Kolb Rd to Sabino Canyon Rd. . FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
